intro: Iberis amara var. decipiens, commonly known as the bitter candytuft, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features basal rosettes of hairy, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is characterized by its bitter taste, which is due to the presence of glucosinolates. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
